metadata.synopsis: Volo has been caught by the goblins and imprisoned. He has an invisbility potion he can use to escape once he's out of the cage, but he needs the player's help. He's a combination of desperate for help and his usal, confident self.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe debugbook7>2>4>3>24. goto 330 -85. Talk to voloNote: to open the cage, either pick the lock or kill the guard and take the key

0.speaker: Volo
0.text: You there! A friendly face. You haven't the looks of one of these cultists about you, no sir!

37.speaker: Volo
37.text: I'm in no hurry to take my turn on that spit out front. Perhaps you'd be so kind as to unlock this cage?

65.speaker: Player
65.text: How did you end up in this place?

62.speaker: Volo
62.text: Curiosity, my friend. It didn't benefit the cat, but it's the foundation of my career.

76.speaker: Volo
76.text: Though I admit I've hit something of an impasse. Please - unlock my cell?

31.speaker: Player
31.text: All right - I'll get you out.

4.speaker: Volo
4.text: Bless you, my friend! I'll wait nicely, but please don't tarry!

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I'll think about it. No promises.

36.speaker: Volo
36.text: I don't need a promise, my friend. Only an honest attempt. Please - do consider it!

2.speaker: Player
2.text: What career could possibly involve getting locked up by goblins?

75.speaker: Volo
75.text: Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker, at your service.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: And you expect me to help you in return for nothing?

54.speaker: Volo
54.text: Of course not! As compensation, I can assure the tale of your heroism will live on... forever!

67.speaker: Player
67.text: And just how do you propose doing that?

73.speaker: Volo
73.text: Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker, at your service.

41.speaker: Volo
41.text: Help me, and I'll make sure everyone in Faerûn knows you for the hero you are.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: That's all? Hardly seems worth the trouble.

82.speaker: Volo
82.text: Then please, a favour - notable figure to notable figure.

53.speaker: Volo
53.text: You may not recognise me in these dire straits, but my name is Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker.

42.speaker: Volo
42.text: Open this cell and I'll never forget the kindness!

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I'm not interested in that sort of attention.

60.speaker: Volo
60.text: I'll write an anonymous account of your largesse, then! None will know your name, yet your doings will live on!

30.speaker: Volo
30.text: Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker, at your service.

46.speaker: Volo
46.text: Why... of course! You were the one with the... name!

7.speaker: Player
7.text: We met in the druids' grove, don't you remember?

22.speaker: Volo
22.text: Ah, of course. Good thing we cleared out of there, by the by. These goblins are planning a raid on the place as we speak.

19.speaker: Volo
19.text: But! No matter. Here I am and here you are. Please - unlock this cell and we can both of us escape.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: You're Volo, right? I've read your work.

16.speaker: Volo
16.text: Aha! An individual of some learning, I see. You're quite right.

79.speaker: Volo
79.text: Well, I will be at your service. Once I've been freed from this ensconsement. Speaking of which...

11.speaker: Volo
11.text: Gods bless you, friend. I'll wait 'til the coast is quite clear and be gone!
11.context: InternalNodeContext: Volo has been freed and is waiting for player to leave the region so he can disappear out of sight.

12.speaker: Volo
12.text: Ah! My friend! We can speak freely.

15.speaker: Volo
15.text: Ha-HA! I knew I could count on you, my friend.
15.context: InternalNodeContext: The cage is unlocked. Player talked to Volo prior to unlocking the cage.

43.speaker: Volo
43.text: We mustn't tarry, but I'd hate for our friendship to end here. Please - won't you meet me, once we've both slipped the goblin yoke?

35.speaker: Player
35.text: A fine mess you landed yourself in. How'd you get caught?

69.speaker: Volo
69.text: Why, by design, my friend. How better to learn the ways of a people than to live among them?

71.speaker: Volo
71.text: I daresay the experiment has proven most fruitful, too. I'll be happy to share my findings... once we've found somewhere safe to parley.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Slip the yoke? How do you intend to do that exactly?

58.speaker: Volo
58.text: An invisibility potion, my friend. A bit less refined than your mendacious methods, but by god it'll do the trick!

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I'm not looking for extra company right now. You go your way, I go mine.

20.speaker: Volo
20.text: Pish posh! Allies are a difficult find in the area, my friend. You'll want Volo in your corner, believe you me.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Go to my camp. We'll talk there, once we're both safe.

10.speaker: Volo
10.text: Smashing! Soon, my friend - soon we can share a flagon of something liquid and a tale of derring-do!

51.speaker: Volo
51.text: I'll slip away when the coast is clear. See you soon, my friend! I simply can't wait to pick your brain!

39.speaker: Volo
39.text: Well, I suppose this is 'goodbye,' my friend. I wish you the greatest of luck and I hope I shall recall you favourably in my records of the day's events.

56.speaker: Volo
56.text: I'll slip away when the coast is clear. And I wish you the greatest possible luck in your mysterious endeavours. Ta!

17.speaker: Volo
17.text: Ha-HA! Hang the key - I see you've no need at all! Thank you for your help, my friend.
17.context: InternalNodeContext: Player got Volo out of the cage (teleport i.e.) and talked to him prior to releasing.

34.speaker: Volo
34.text: This lock, my friend! Surely a strong arm like you can make short work of it.

78.speaker: Volo
78.text: Ha-HA! Look at this - I'm quite saved, and by means most extraordinary!
78.context: InternalNodeContext: Player got Volo out of the cage (teleport i.e.) and DIDN'T talked to him prior to releasing.

32.speaker: Volo
32.text: A joy to see a familiar face in such a... precarious setting.

1.speaker: Volo
1.text: I guarantee the story of your daring rescue of my person will live on for aeons!

83.speaker: Player
83.text: And just how will you be accomplishing that?

57.speaker: Volo
57.text: Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker, at your service.

3.speaker: Volo
3.text: Once I've written you into one of my books, there won't be a tavern in Faerûn you can enter without receiving a hero's welcome.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: I'm not looking for that sort of attention.

21.speaker: Volo
21.text: I'll write an anonymous account of your heroism, then! None will know your name, yet your doings will live on!

64.speaker: Volo
64.text: Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker, at your service.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Get yourself to safety - and quick.

18.speaker: Volo
18.text: I intend to do just that. A trusty invisibility potion goes a long way in a place like this.

61.speaker: Volo
61.text: We mustn't tarry, but I'd hate for our friendship to end here. Please - won't you meet me, once we've both slipped the goblin yoke?

26.speaker: Player
26.text: You know what else lives on for aeons? Gold. You owe me.

29.speaker: Volo
29.text: Bah, what's a bit of metal between allies? I'll do one better.

33.speaker: Volo
33.text: Tell me where we can meet each other, once we've slipped the goblin yoke, and I'll offer much more than gold. Knowledge, my friend, is priceless.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Remember my name when you're crediting the story's author. It's [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53].

77.speaker: Volo
77.text: That will sound ridiculous. But, fine. If you insist. As much as it pains me to cede creative control...

80.speaker: Volo
80.text: Ha-HA! Look at this - I'm quite saved!
80.context: InternalNodeContext: The cage is unlocked. Player DIDN'T talked to Volo prior to unlocking the cage.
